name: new moon hat
notes:
materials
- 2 (2, 3, 3) balls of purl soho’s [simply alpaca][1], 100% undyed black alpaca yarn. each ball of this fingering-weight yarn is 164 yards/ 50 grams; approximately 180 (250, 360, 445) yards required.
- us 4 (3.5 mm), 12- or 16-inch [circular knitting needles][2], depending on size you are making
- a set of us 4 [double pointed needles][3] or us 4, 32-inch circular needles for [magic loop][4]
- [stitch markers][5], including one unique

gauge
37 stitches and 31 rounds = 4 inches in 2×2 rib, unstretched, holding yarn double

sizes
for help choosing a hat size, check out our complete guide on [how to knit the right hat size][6]!

baby (toddler/kid, adult small, adult large)

- finished circumference: 8¾ (10½, 12, 13¾) inches circumference, comfortably stretching to approximately 14–16 (16–19, 19–22, 22–25) inches
- finished height, cuffed: 6 (7, 8¾, 9¾) inches tall

sample: we knit the adult small size.

pattern designed and written by purl soho designer, [gaby bush][7].


  [1]: https://www.purlsoho.com/simply-alpaca.html
  [2]: https://www.purlsoho.com/tools-and-notions/collection_filter--circular_needles.html
  [3]: https://www.purlsoho.com/tools-and-notions/collection_filter--double_pointed_needles.html
  [4]: https://www.purlsoho.com/create/magic-loop/
  [5]: https://www.purlsoho.com/tools-and-notions/collection_filter--stitch_markers.html
